intro: Echites montanus, commonly known as mountain echites, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Echites montanus plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
